intro: Commelina prostrata, commonly known as the prostrate spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It is a herbaceous perennial that typically grows in moist, shady environments. The plant features small, arrow-shaped leaves and produces clusters of blue or violet flowers. It has a rhizomatous root system that allows it to spread easily through vegetative reproduction. Commelina prostrata is often found in wetlands, stream banks, and forest floors where it thrives in high humidity.
